meanings.definition: To use money, resources, etc. carefully and without wasting them.
meanings.sent1: She is economizing by buying only what she needs.
meanings.sent2: My parents are economizing by turning off lights when not in use.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was economizing its nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: He was economizing his energy for the final sprint.
meanings.sent5: Economizing on water during a drought is crucial for conservation.

meanings.definition: To save money by spending it carefully.
meanings.sent1: They are economizing by cooking meals at home instead of eating out.
meanings.sent2: I am economizing by using coupons and shopping during sales.
meanings.sent3: The kids were economizing their allowance to buy a new toy.
meanings.sent4: She was economizing her time to finish the project before the deadline.
meanings.sent5: Economizing on groceries can lead to significant savings over time.

meanings.sent1: The company is economizing by recycling paper and reducing plastic use.
meanings.sent2: We are economizing by reusing containers instead of throwing them away.
meanings.sent3: The chef was economizing by using leftover ingredients to create a new dish.
meanings.sent4: She was economizing her efforts by focusing on the most important tasks.
meanings.sent5: Economizing on electricity helps in reducing environmental impact.
